net.proteusframework.internet.http

Interface Request


  • public interface Request
    Interface for a server request.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Method Detail

      • getContentType

        @Nullable
LenientContentType getContentType()
        Get the content type of the request body.
        Returns:
        the content type of the request body. May be null.

      • getCookieByName

        Cookie getCookieByName(String name)
        Get cookie by name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name.
        Returns:
        the cookie or null.

      • getCookies

        Cookie[] getCookies()
        Get the cookies in the request.
        Returns:
        an array of cookies.

      • getDataProviderContainer

        DataProviderContainer getDataProviderContainer()
        Get the DataProvider container associated with this request.
        Returns:
        the container.

      • getDocumentContentType

        @Nullable
LenientContentType getDocumentContentType()
        Get the document content type.

        The requester can specify a document content type by passing in a header: "X-DocumentContentType". This can be used by the responder to tailor the response to the document type in use by the code making the request. An example of this is to output content in XHTML form instead of HTML form if the originating document is XHTML.

        Returns:
        the content or null if not specified.

      • getDocumentContentTypeOrNegotiatedContentType

        LenientContentType getDocumentContentTypeOrNegotiatedContentType()
        Get the document content type if specified otherwise return the negotiated content type.
        Returns:
        the document content type or the negotiated content type.

      • getFallbackLocales

        List<Locale> getFallbackLocales()
        Get the fallback locales for the request.
        Returns:
        the fallback locales.

      • getFileItem

        org.apache.commons.fileupload.FileItem getFileItem(CharSequence key)
        Return the file item for the specified key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key.
        Returns:
        the file item or null.

      • getFileItems

        List<org.apache.commons.fileupload.FileItem> getFileItems(CharSequence key)
        Return the file items for the specified key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key.
        Returns:
        the file items or empty list.

      • getHeaderValue

        String getHeaderValue(String headerName)
        Get the header value. If the header has multiple values, the first is returned.
        Parameters:
        headerName - the header name.
        Returns:
        the value or null if there is no header value.

      • getHostname

        Hostname getHostname()
        Get the site that the request is for.
        Returns:
        the hostname.

      • getInputStream

        InputStream getInputStream()
        Get the request data as in InputStream.

        Either getInputStream() or getReader() may be called, but not both.

        The data may already be consumed which can cause an error to be generated in some cases. Be careful mixing calls to get the request body and get parameters especially if the content type is either application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data.

        Returns:
        the input stream.

      • getLocaleContext

        LocaleContext getLocaleContext()
        Get the LocaleContext for the request.
        Returns:
        the locale context.

      • getMethod

        String getMethod()
        Get the method of the request.
        Returns:
        the method. One of "get" or "post" (may be mixed/upper/lower case).

      • getNegotiatedContentType

        LenientContentType getNegotiatedContentType()
        Get the negotiated content type for response. This refers to the content to be generated as a result of this request. This is typically based on the user agent's Accept taking into consideration the resource being requested.

        NOTE: this is in the request instead of the response since the request is available sooner or in places where an opportunity to respond to the request is not yet available.

        Returns:
        the content type requested.
        See Also:
        RFC 2616 §14

      • getPageElementPath

        RequestPath getPageElementPath()
        Get the request path that mapped to the response. In the case of a wildcard path, this will not include the path info.
        Returns:
        the request path.

      • getParameter

        String getParameter(CharSequence key)
        Get the parameter value for the specified key. If there are multiple values, the first value is returned.
        Parameters:
        key - the parameter key.
        Returns:
        the value or null if no value exists for the specified key.
        See Also:
        getParameterMap()

      • getParameter

        String getParameter(CharSequence key,
                  String defaultValue)
        Get the parameter value for the specified key. If there are multiple values, the first value is returned.
        Parameters:
        key - the parameter key.
        defaultValue - the value to return if the parameter map does not return a value.
        Returns:
        the value or defaultValue if no value exists for the specified key.
        See Also:
        getParameterMap()

      • getParameterMap

        Map<String,String[]> getParameterMap()
        Get the parameter map. This is the same as calling getParameterMap(Context.TARGETED).
        Returns:
        the parameters.
        See Also:
        getParameterMap(ParameterView.Context)

      • getParameterMap

        Map<String,String[]> getParameterMap(ParameterView.Context context)
        Get the parameter map.
        Parameters:
        context - the context.
        Returns:
        the parameters.

      • getParameterOrEmpty

        String getParameterOrEmpty(CharSequence key)
        Get the parameter value for the specified key. If there are multiple values, the first value is returned.
        Parameters:
        key - the parameter key.
        Returns:
        the value or empty string if no value exists for the specified key.
        See Also:
        getParameterMap()

      • getParameterView

        ParameterView getParameterView(ParameterView.Context context)
        Get the parameter view.
        Parameters:
        context - the context.
        Returns:
        the view.
        See Also:
        getParameterMap(ParameterView.Context)

      • getPathInfo

        String getPathInfo()
        Get the path information for the request.

        The path information follows the request path but precedes the query string and will start with a "/" character. This method returns null if there was no extra path information.

        Returns:
        the path information or null.

      • getPrincipal

        net.proteusframework.users.model.Principal getPrincipal()
        Get the current principal.
        Returns:
        the current principal or null.

      • getReader

        BufferedReader getReader()
        Get the request data as Reader.

        Either getInputStream() or getReader() may be called, but not both.

        The data may already be consumed which can cause an error to be generated in some cases. Be careful mixing calls to get the request body and get parameters especially if the content type is either application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data.

        Returns:
        the reader.

      • getReferer

        String getReferer()
        Return the referer.

        http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_referer#Origin_of_the_term_referer

        Returns:
        the referer or null if not set.

      • getRefererRequestPath

        RequestPath getRefererRequestPath()
        Return the referer RequestPath.
        Returns:
        the referer RequestPath or null.

      • getRemoteAddress

        String getRemoteAddress()
        Returns the IP address of the client (or last proxy) initiating the request
        Returns:
        a String containing the IP address of the client that sent the request

      • getSession

        ServletSession getSession(Scope scope)
        Get the session. The session holds transient values.
        Parameters:
        scope - the scope.
        Returns:
        the session.

      • getTimeZone

        TimeZone getTimeZone()
        Get the timezone.
        Returns:
        the timezone.

      • getUserLocale

        Locale getUserLocale()
        Get the user locale.
        Returns:
        the locale.

      • getVoidElementClosing

        String getVoidElementClosing()
        Get the Void element closing string. One of: ">" or "/>".
        Returns:
        the Void element closing string.

      • hasSession

        boolean hasSession(Scope scope)
        Determines if the request has a session.
        Parameters:
        scope - the scope.
        Returns:
        true or false.

      • isPartial

        boolean isPartial()
        Return true if request is partial.

        This is used to indicate that the request is only for a subset of a normal response (e.g. web page).

        Returns:
        true or false.

      • isRequestForXmlContent

        boolean isRequestForXmlContent()
        Convenience method for determining if request is for XML content like XHTML, Voice XML, XML RSS Feed, etc.
        Returns:
        true if the request is for XML content or false.

      • isSecure

        boolean isSecure()
        Return true if the request was made securely.
        Returns:
        true if the request was made securely.

      • setLocale

        void setLocale(Locale locale)
        Set the locale. This applies to the current request only and only to user's of this Request object.
        Parameters:
        locale - the locale.

      • setTimeZone

        void setTimeZone(TimeZone tz)
        Set the time zone.
        Parameters:
        tz - the time zone.

      • setUserLocale

        void setUserLocale(Locale locale)
        Set the user locale. Setting this will override any content negotiation for the locale. If the user has cookies enabled, then the locale will be the preferred locale for future content negotiation with that user.
        Parameters:
        locale - the locale. If null, the locale is negotiated.
